words.definition: To accelerate means to increase in speed.
words.example: When he stepped on the gas pedal, the motorcycle accelerated.

words.definition: If you do something anew, you do it again and in a different way.
words.example: Though he had failed his driving test, he decided to try it anew.

words.definition: A defect is a part of something that is wrong or missing.
words.example: All these bottles have a defect and must be sent back to the warehouse.

words.definition: If something is dreary, then it is dull, dark, and lifeless.
words.example: After the fire, this section of forest is rather dreary.

words.definition: To duplicate something means to copy it exactly.
words.example: She duplicated the key so her brother could have one.

words.definition: If something is electromagnetic, it relates to electricity and magnetism.
words.example: The scientist studied the electromagnetic field of the Earth.

words.definition: An electron is a tiny particle in an atom with a negative charge.
words.example: Electrons move around the nucleus of an atom.

words.definition: To glide means to move smoothly and easily.
words.example: The eagle glided over the mountain peaks.

words.definition: If someone is ingenious, they are very clever at inventing things.
words.example: He came up with an ingenious plan to solve the problem.

words.definition: An innovation is a new idea, method, or invention.
words.example: The new phone is a great innovation in technology.

words.definition: If something is innovative, it uses new ideas or methods.
words.example: The company is known for its innovative approach to design.

words.definition: To launch means to send something into the air or into space.
words.example: The rocket was launched from the space center.

words.definition: If something is meteorological, it relates to the study of weather.
words.example: The meteorological station tracks the movement of storms.

words.definition: Meteorology is the scientific study of the weather.
words.example: She decided to study meteorology at the university.

words.definition: To penetrate something means to enter or go through it.
words.example: The bullet penetrated the wooden board.

words.definition: Propulsion is the force that moves something forward.
words.example: The jet engine provides the propulsion for the plane.

words.definition: To simulate something means to copy the way it looks or acts.
words.example: The computer program simulates a flight on a plane.

words.definition: To spur someone means to encourage them to do something.
words.example: The award spurred him to work even harder.

words.definition: To stimulate something means to make it more active.
words.example: The teacher used games to stimulate the students' interest.

words.definition: If someone is tenacious, they do not give up easily.
words.example: She was tenacious in her efforts to find a job.
